answerText: ames Branch Cabell[10] In a 1964 court case concerning Grove Press, the U.S. Supreme Court overturned the obscenity ban on the core works of this author, which include Tropic of Cancer, Tropic of Capricorn, and Black Spring.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Haverford Round 10 | 15 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: For 10 points each, name the following about works and authors that were at the heart of obscenity trials. [10] This author of The Biography of Manuel underwent an obscenity trial in 1920 after the publication of his satirical fantasy novel Jurgen, A Comedy of Justice.
